title: Google\Cloud\Datastore\V1\AggregationQuery\Aggregation\Count
name: Count
description:
Count of entities that match the query.

The COUNT(*) aggregation function operates on the entire entity so it does not require a field reference.

Generated from protobuf message google.datastore.v1.AggregationQuery.Aggregation.Count

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.up_to
params.description: Optional. Optional constraint on the maximum number of entities to count. This provides a way to set an upper bound on the number of entities to scan, limiting latency and cost. Unspecified is interpreted as no bound. If a zero value is provided, a count result of zero should always be expected. High-Level Example: AGGREGATE COUNT_UP_TO(1000) OVER ( SELECT * FROM k ); Requires: * Must be non-negative when present.
